service_description: Offers a culturally-based  psychosocial addiction treatment program for self-identified Aboriginal female youth ages 12 to 18 who are involved with the justice system. The holistic residential program includes an educational component  life skills training  anger management  and a youth substance abuse management program. The 20-week program provides a safe and nurturing environment where young women are given opportunities to develop and enhance skills and assets related to successful community living and personal well-being. Open custody program  referral required from a probation officer.

organization.name: Elizabeth Fry Society of Greater Vancouver
